intro: Impatiens tienchuanensis, commonly known as the Tienchuan Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant is herbaceous, with opposite leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
